description: To rezone 2231-2247 East 41st Avenue from R1-1 (Residential Inclusive) District to RR-2B (Residential Rental) to permit the development of a five-storey rental building. A floor space ratio (FSR) of 2.20 and height of 16.8 m (55 ft.) are proposed.

To rezone 6470 Larch Street from R1-1 (Residential Inclusive) District to RR-2B (Residential Rental) District, to permit the development of a five-storey secured market rental building. A floor space ratio (FSR) of 2.20 and height of 16.8 m (55 ft.) are proposed.

To rezone 4330-4408 Arbutus Street and 2092 Nanton Avenue from R1-1 (Residential Inclusive) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District, to permit the development of a six-storey, 162-unit Community Care Facility. A floor space ratio (FSR) of 3.87 and a height of 27.5 m (90 ft.) with additional height for a rooftop amenity are proposed.

To rezone 848 Seymour Street from DD (Downtown) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District, to permit the development of a 30-storey hotel. A floor space ratio (FSR) of 17.67 and a height of 97.7 m (321 ft.) are proposed.

applicant: DIALOG BC Architecture Engineering Interior Design Planning Inc.
behalf: Lu'ma Native Housing Society, ALT Commercial Housing Society
description: To rezone 1710-1730 East Pender Street from RM-4 and RM-4N (Residential) Districts to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District, to permit the development of an 18-storey mixed-use building containing 191 social housing units, including six live-work units, and ground floor commercial space. A floor space ratio (FSR) of 5.58 and a height of 60.8 m (199 ft.) with additional height for a rooftop amenity space are proposed.
To rezone 692 West 30th Avenue from R1-1 (Residential Inclusive) District to RM-8A (Multiple Dwelling) District, to permit a townhouse development with a maximum floor space ratio (FSR) of 1.20.
To rezone 688 West 29th Avenue from R1-1 (Residential Inclusive) District to RM-8A (Multiple Dwelling) District, to permit a townhouse development with a maximum floor space ratio (FSR) of 1.20.

urls.title: Yellow Memorandum dated December 8, 2023, from the Interim Director of Planning, Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability

behalf: Mosaic Flora and Fauna Holdings Ltd.
description: Rezoning of 4711-4787 Cambie Street from R1-1 (Residential Inclusive) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District to permit the development of two six-storey, strata-titled residential buildings. A floor space ratio (FSR) of 2.65 and a height of 23.6 m (77.4 ft.) are proposed. The development includes 114 strata-titled residential units.

To rezone the area from R1-1 (Residential Inclusive) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District, to permit the development of two six-storey residential buildings consisting of 146 secured-market rental units, of which five units would be below-market rental. A floor space ratio (FSR) of 2.88 and a height of 20.7 m (68 ft.) with additional height for a rooftop amenity and mechanical appurtenances are proposed.

behalf: Strata Corporation of 3352-3386 Vanness Avenue Strata Plan LMS992 and the registered owners of the strata lots in Strata Plan LMS922, and the registered owner of 3347 Clive Avenue
description: The applicant wants to rezone the consolidated lands at 3352-3386 Vanness Avenue and 3347 Clive Avenue from CD-1(201) (Comprehensive Development) District and CD-1(218) (Comprehensive Development) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District, respectively, to increase the maximum floor space ratio (FSR) from 1.45 and 0.6 respectively to 11.38 and the maximum building height from 35.5 m (120 ft.) and 11.9 m (39 ft.) respectively to 104.9 m (3 44 ft.), to permit a mixed-use development with 30-storey (west tower) and 33-storey (east tower) buildings connected with a six-storey podium, with 679 secured rental units, of which 10% of the residential floor area will be secured at below market rents, commercial uses on the ground floor and a 37-space turn-key childcare facility for City ownership.

zoning.previousZoningCode: CD-1(201) (Comprehensive Development) District and CD-1(218) (Comprehensive Development) District

description: The applicant wants to rezone the lands from IC-2 (Industrial) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District to increase the maximum floor space ratio (FSR) from 3.0 to 6.27 and the maximum building height from 18.3 m (60 ft.) to 79.3 m (260 ft.) with mechanical appurtenances permitted up to a maximum of 3.6 m (12 ft.) above the permitted building height, to permit the development of a 25-storey, mixed-use building containing 210 secured-rental housing units, of which 20% of the residential floor area will be secured as below-market rental units, with commercial space on the ground floor.

The applicant wants to rezone the lands from RM-5A (Residential) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District, to increase the maximum floor space ratio (FSR) from 2.2 to 11.9 and the maximum building height from 18.30 m (60 ft.) to 91.44 m (300 ft.) to permit the development of a 32-storey residential building containing 269 secured-rental units of which 20% of the residential floor area will be secured as below-market rental units.

The rezoning application is to rezone the lands from R1-1 (Residential Inclusive) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District to increase the floor space ratio (FSR) from 0.70 to 0.75 and the building height from 11.5 m (38 ft.) to 13.8 m (45 ft.), to permit 28 secured market rental residential units.

Rezoning of 10511 Lassam Road from the “Single Detached RS1/E” Zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/B)” Zone to permit the property to be subdivided to create two single-family lots with access from Lassam Road. Each proposed lot at the subject site will be approximately 12.6 m (41 ft.) wide and approximately 575 m² (6,189.25 ft²) in area.

Rezoning of 3660/3662 Williams Road from the “Two-Unit Dwellings (RD1)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/B)” zone in order to permit the property to be subdivided into two single-family residential lots each with vehicle access from Williams Road. Existing stratified duplex with one secondary suite on the subject site, which will be demolished. Each new lot will provide a secondary suite. Proposed subdivision plan includes two lots, each 429.0 m2 (4,617.72 ft2) and 463.9 m² (4,993.37 ft²) in area.

behalf: 1303287 B.C. Ltd. (Balraj Singh Sanghera and Rajbir Kaur Chatha)
description: Rezoning to permit the property to be subdivided into two single-family lots, each with vehicle access from Seabrook Crescent. The proposed subdivision plan and draft site plan are provided in Attachment 2.

behalf: Cliff Chun and Kai Shen Hsiung of 1296168 BC Ltd. and Yi Jen Wang and Kai Shen Hsiung of Terra West Properties Ltd.
description: Rezoning of 8120 and 8140 No. 1 Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)” zone to permit the development of nine townhouse units, with vehicle access from No. 1 Road.

behalf: Thomas Mau Shing Ng, Ling Y Ha, Shui Ting Chua
description: Rezoning of 10840 and 10860 Bonavista Gate from the “Two-Unit Dwellings (RD1)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/C)” zone in order to subdivide the existing duplex lot into two single-family lots, each with vehicle access from Bonavista Gate. The proposed subdivision plan and site plan are provided in Attachment 2.

Rezoning of 3300 Granville Avenue from Single Detached (RS1/E) zone to Single Detached (RS2/B) zone to allow the property to be subdivided into two single-family lots, each with a one bedroom secondary suite. Existing single-family dwelling to be demolished prior to subdivision. Vehicle access proposed to be from Granville Avenue.

Rezoning of 5471, 5491/5493, 5531, 5551, 5571, 5591, 5595, 5611/5613 Steveston Highway from “Single Detached (RS1/B)” zone, “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone and “Two-Unit Dwellings (RD1)” zone to the “Medium Density Townhouses (RTM2)” zone in order to permit the development of 30 townhouse units with seven secondary suites and a right-in/right-out vehicle access from Steveston Highway. The proposed density is 0.65 floor area ratio (FAR).
Rezoning from “Single Detached (RS1/E)” Zone to “High Density Townhouses (RTH1)” Zone to permit the development of four townhouse units with one secondary suite

behalf: Pardeep Bhullar, Navjinder Bhullar and Gurveer Bhullar
description: Rezoning of 10331/10333 Bird Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/B)” zone in order to permit the property to be subdivided into two lots. Each lot at the subject site will be approximately 12 m (40 ft.) wide and approximately 691 m2 (7,437.8 ft2) in area.

behalf: Gurjit Pooni, Sahib Bath, Lakhbir Bath, Dilbag Bath
description: Rezoning of 9371 Dolphin Avenue from 'Single Detached (RS1/B)' zone to 'Single Detached (RS2/K)' zone to permit the property to be subdivided to create two single-family lots with access from Dolphin Avenue.

Rezoning of 7560 Ash Street from the 'Single Detached (RS 1/F)' zone to the 'Single Detached (RS2/E)' zone, to allow the property to be subdivided into two single-family lots. Vehicle access to the west lot (Lot 1) is proposed from Ash Street. Vehicle access to the eastern lot (Lot 2) is proposed from a new extension of Armstrong Street. The site is currently occupied by an existing single-family dwelling on the western portion of the lot, which will remain on proposed Lot 1.

Rezoning of 10111 & 10113 No. 5 Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Arterial Road Compact Two-Unit Dwellings (RCD)” zone. This rezoning would permit the property to be subdivided to create three lots each containing a front-to-back duplex with vehicle access from the existing rear lane.

address: 8520 Railway Avenue, 8540 Railway Avenue, 8560 Railway Avenue
description: Rezoning from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” Zone to the “Low Rise Rental Apartment (ZLR47) – Railway Avenue (Blundell)” Zone to permit the construction of a 100 per cent rental residential apartment development consisting of a four-storey building, containing 58 units for seniors. Key components include 29 Low-End Market Rental (LEMR) units and 29 market rental units, approximately 1,534 m2 of LEMR housing and approximately 1,605 m2 of market rental housing, all secured in perpetuity with rental tenure zoning and housing agreements registered on Title, meeting Energy Step Code Step 4, indoor amenity space of approximately 102 m2 and shared outdoor amenity space of approximately 495 m2.

Rezoning from 'Agriculture (AG1)' zone to 'Light Industrial (IL)' zone to permit the development of two multi-tenant industrial buildings for a total of 13 strata-titled units. Buildings total approximately 4,266 m2 in light industrial space and 1,276 m2 in ancillary office space. Proposed setback of 3.28 m from No. 5 Road and proposed height of 11.6 m. Landscaping and tree replacement planting within the front yard setback, in conjunction with required frontage upgrades along No. 5 Road (multi-use pathway and landscaped boulevard), will improve the pedestrian scale of the development.

Rezoning of 7520 Ash Street from the “Single Detached (RS1/F)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/E)” zone, to allow the property to be subdivided into two single-family lots. Proposed Lot 1 will be approximately 19.2 m (63 ft.) wide and 799 m² (8,600 ft²) in area. Proposed Lot 2 will be approximately 19.2 m (63 ft.) wide and 799 m² (8,600 ft²) in area. Retain existing single-family dwelling on Lot 1 and construct a new single detached house with a secondary suite on Lot 2.

The applicant wants to rezone 7100 and 7120 Ash Street from the “Single Detached (RS1/F)” zone to the “Town Housing (ZT16) - South McLennan and St. Albans Sub-Area (City Centre)” zone to permit the development of 17 townhouses.

Rezoning of lands to create a new Residential/Limited Commercial (ZMU54) zone and a School & Institutional Use (SI) zone for the development of a mixed-use mid- and high-rise development. The proposed development includes a total floor area of 17,154.73 m2 comprised of 163 dwellings, including 136 market housing units and 27 affordable housing units, as well as 52,834 ft2 of non-residential hotel uses. It also includes the transfer of parcels for public open space and transportation related infrastructure.

zoning.newZoningCode: Residential/Limited Commercial (ZMU54) and School & Institutional Use (SI)
zoning.newZoningDescription: mixed use residential and limited commercial with school and institutional use

description: The applicant wants to rezone 3560 Moncton Street from 'Steveston Commercial (CS2)' to 'Commercial Mixed Use (ZMU43) - Steveston Village' zone in order to develop a two-storey, mixed use building containing approximately 419 m2 (4,513 ft2) of commercial space at grade and five residential units above, with vehicular access from the lane to the west.

behalf: Satwant Atwal and Surinder Grewal of 1275306 BC Ltd.
description: Rezoning from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Low-Density Townhouses (RTL4)” zone to permit the property to be developed for 18 townhouse units, with vehicle access from Granville Avenue.

The applicant is seeking to rezone the site to permit the development of a mixed-use mid-rise development including 186 dwelling units, 167 strata units, and 19 Low-End Market Rental (LEMR) units. This includes one five-storey mixed-use building, one four-storey apartment building, and one two-storey amenity building atop a common parkade. The total floor area is approximately 15,661 m2 (168,569 ft2) comprised of approximately 130 m2 (1,400 ft2) of City-owned community amenity space (Community Policing Office) and approximately 603.9 m2 (6,500 ft2) of commercial space.

address: 8635, 8655, 8675 and 8695 Cook Crescent, Surplus Portion of the Spires Road and Cook Crescent road allowance
description: Rezoning of a 3,302.8 m2 site from 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' zone to 'Town Housing (ZT103) – Parking Structure Townhouses (Spires Road – Cook Crescent)' zone. Proposal includes a stacked townhouse development with 27 townhouse units, including two single-level Basic Universal Housing (BUH) units, four three-level townhouse units, fourteen four-level townhouse units, and seven four-level townhouse units each with a secondary suite. Servicing Agreement required for frontage beautification, road widening, new concrete sidewalk, landscaped boulevard, fire hydrants, public walkways, storm sewer and sanitary sewer upgrades, and service connections.

zoning.newZoningDescription: Town Housing (ZT103) – Parking Structure Townhouses (Spires Road – Cook Crescent)

description: Rezoning of 9671 No. 1 Road from “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to “Compact Single Detached (RC2)” zone, to permit the property to be subdivided to create two single-family lots, each with vehicle access from the rear lane.

behalf: Khalid Hasan of Pakland Qadri Gardens Ltd.
description: Rezoning of 7371 No. 4 Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/F)” zone to the “Medium Density Townhouses (RTM2)” zone, to permit the property to be developed for 19 townhouse units including two secondary suites, with vehicle access from General Currie Road.

The applicant wants to rezone the site at 10611 and 10751 River Drive from the “Industrial Storage (IS)” zone to a new “Low to Mid Rise Apartment (ZLR46) – Bridgeport” site specific zone to permit the development of a residential mixed tenure low-rise and mid-rise development. The proposal includes 181 dwelling units, including 150 strata units, 13 market rental units, and 18 Low-End Market Rental (LEMR) units. It also includes one four-storey and two six-storey apartment buildings, and a one-storey amenity building. The total floor area is approximately 15,588 m2 (167,790 ft2). Road, dike, engineering improvement, and public walkway works will be secured through the City’s standard Servicing Agreement process prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw.

zoning.newZoningCode: Low to Mid Rise Apartment (ZLR46) - Bridgeport

description: Landa Oval Development Ltd. has applied to the City of Richmond to rezone 6851 and 6871 Elmbridge Way from 'Light Industrial Business Park (IB1)' to 'High Density Mixed Use (ZMU52)-Oval Village (City Centre)' to construct a mixed use development in the Oval Village area. The development includes 13,832 m2 (148,887 ft2) of commercial floor area consisting of a 189 room hotel and supporting uses in a tower, along with portions of the development podium and at-grade commercial space. It also includes 27,655 m2 (297,778 ft2) of residential floor area consisting of 321 market residential units and 35 affordable Low End Market Rental (LEMR) housing units. Additionally, dedication and construction of a new road, widening and completion of the existing lane, and related off-site works are to be completed through a City Servicing Agreement.

zoning.newZoningDescription: High-Density Mixed Use – Oval Village (City Centre)

applicant: Ajit Aujla and New Villa Holdings
description: The proposed rezoning would permit the property to be subdivided to create two lots, each with a principal dwelling and an accessory coach house above a detached garage, with vehicle access from the existing rear lane. The proposed site-specific zone is being introduced to facilitate the proposed lot depth of 34.6 m (113.5 ft.), which does not meet the minimum required lot depth of the standard “Coach Houses (RCH1)” zone of 35.0 m (114.8 ft.). The proposed site-specific zone is identical in all provisions to the standard “Coach Houses (RCH1)” zone, but allows for a reduced lot depth.

Rezoning of 12260 Woodhead Road and a portion of 12288 Woodhead Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/F)” Zone and the “Single Detached (RS1/B)” Zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/B)” Zone to permit a subdivision to create three lots with vehicle access from Woodhead Road. Proposed lots will be 12.0 m (39.37 ft.) wide and approximately 482.80 m² (5,196.82 ft²) in area.

Rezoning of 8180 Heather Street from “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/A)” zone, to permit the property to be subdivided into two single-family lots with the western lot accessed from Heather Street and the eastern lot accessed from Dixon Avenue. Existing single-family dwelling on the subject property with vehicular access from Heather Street to be demolished. Proposed subdivision plan included in Attachment 2.

Rezoning from “Single Family Detached (RS1/E)” Zone to “High Density Townhouse (RTH1)” Zone to permit the development of five three-storey townhouse units with vehicle access through an easement registered on Title of the adjacent property to the north at 7433 St. Albans Road. A preliminary site plan, building elevations and landscape plan are contained in Attachment 2.

behalf: 1089260 B C Ltd. (CIBT Education Group and Global Education City Holdings Inc.)
description: Rezoning of lands to construct an 11-storey hotel with 183 guest rooms, an 8-storey office building, retail and restaurant uses at grade, and 2 ½ levels of underground parking. Total floor area of approximately 21,625 m2 (232,769 ft2) comprising approximately 7,702 m² (82,908 ft²) of hotel and retail/restaurant and 13,923 m² (149,861 ft²) of office. Design and construction to meet Step 2 of the BC Energy Step Code, together with a low carbon energy plant. Voluntary developer contributions towards public art and community amenities. Off-site works around the perimeter of the subject site and the adjacent City-owned property at 7760 River Road/7891 Cambie Road, including dike upgrades, utility upgrades, road upgrades, and related public realm improvements.

Rezoning of 7420/7440 Langton Road from the “Two-Unit Dwellings (RD1)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/B)” zone to permit the property to be subdivided to create two single-family lots with vehicle access from Langton Road. Proposed subdivision plan includes two single-family lots with one providing a secondary suite and a contribution to the Affordable Housing Reserve Fund for the other. Building footprint on the proposed southern lot has been modified to accommodate the retention of a tree on the site by increasing the required setbacks in the southeast corner. Legal agreement to be registered on Title to ensure that the Tree Protection Zone and additional setback requirements are maintained.

The applicant wants to rezone the property at 8691 Heather Street from the 'Single Detached (RS1/B)' zone to the 'Single Detached (RS2/K)' zone in order to subdivide the property to create two single-family lots, with one lot accessed from Heather Street and one lot accessed from Dolphin Avenue. The proposed subdivision is consistent with the lot fabric and vehicular access of adjacent lots.

The applicant wants to rezone the property to permit the subdivision of the existing single-family lot into two equal-sized single-family lots with secondary suites and vehicle access from Heather Street. The proposed subdivision plan shows two new single-family lots approximately 10m wide. The redevelopment is consistent with the lot fabric, lot width, and vehicular access of lots to the north along Heather Street and with the Ash Street Sub-Area Plan.

behalf: Lorraine S Tsoi, Danny F Leung and Chi L Lau
description: The applicant is applying to rezone 11431 Williams Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Compact Single Detached (RC2)” zone, to permit the property to be subdivided to create two single-family lots, each with vehicle access from the rear lane. The proposed subdivision is shown in Attachment 2. The proposed site plan and preliminary landscape plan are shown in Attachment 3.

Rezoning of 8220 Gilbert Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Arterial Road Two-Unit Dwellings (RDA)” zone to permit the property to be developed into 2 duplex lots with shared vehicle access to Gilbert Road. Proposed amendment to Single-Family Lot Size Policy 5442 to remove 8220 Gilbert Road from the Policy.

Rezoning of 10851/10871 Bird Road from “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to “Single Detached (RS2/B)” zone in order to permit the property to be subdivided into two lots with access from Bird Road. Each proposed lot at the subject site will be approximately 12.1 m (40 ft.) wide and approximately 600 m² (6,458.35 ft²) in area.

applicant: Choice School for Gifted Children Society
description: Rezoning of 20411 & 20451 Westminster Highway from Agriculture (AG1) and Assembly (ASY) Zones to Agriculture and Education (ZA5) - Westminster Highway (East Richmond) Zone. The purpose is to allow the existing education uses, a proposed new 261 m2 (2,809 ft2) classroom building, and implementation of the farm plan, consistent with the approved Agricultural Land Reserve (ALR) non-farm use application (AG 19-881146) approved by Council and the Agricultural Land Commission (ALC).

zoning.newZoningCode: Agriculture and Education (ZA5) - Westminster Highway (East Richmond)

address: 3360 Sexsmith Road, 3380 Sexsmith Road, Portion of 3440 Sexsmith Road
description: Application for rezoning to construct a mixed-use development in the northeast quadrant of the City Centre's Capstan Village. Includes the creation of a two-lot development site, total floor area of 35,823 m2, 392 apartment units, public open space, heritage interpretation, and off-site works.

zoning.previousZoningCode: Assembly (ASY), Single Detached (RS1/F), School & Institutional Use (SI)
zoning.previousZoningDescription: Mixed zoning including assembly, single detached, and institutional use
zoning.newZoningCode: Residential/Limited Commercial and Religious Assembly (ZMU51) -Capstan Village (City Centre)
zoning.newZoningDescription: Mixed zoning for residential, limited commercial, and religious assembly

description: The applicant is proposing to rezone the site at 6071 Azure Road from the “Low Density Townhouses (RTL1)” Zone to the “Low to Mid Rise Apartment (ZLR45) – Thompson” Zone. The proposal includes the redevelopment of an existing rental residential site with 330 new residential rental units including 50 Low-End Market Rental (LEMR) units, 110 moderate income rental units, and 170 market rental units. It also includes the construction of two four-storey apartment buildings and one six-storey apartment building, all located over a single level parking structure. The total floor area is approximately 24,355 m2 (262,156 ft2) with additional indoor amenity space provided over the three buildings. Road and engineering improvement works will be secured through the City’s standard Servicing Agreement processes prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw.

zoning.newZoningCode: Low to Mid Rise Apartment (ZLR45) - Thompson

description: Rezoning of the property at 9100 Cambie Road from the “Gas & Service Stations (CG2)” zone to a new site-specific zone, “Gas Station Commercial (ZC50) – West Cambie”, in order to permit a gas station, convenience store and restaurant. The proposal includes the development of a one-storey building with a total floor area of 303.3 m2 (3,265 ft2) to accommodate a convenience store (approximately 186.2 m2 (2,004 ft2)) and a restaurant (approximately 117.1 m2 (1,261 ft2)). The existing gas station is proposed to remain.

Rezoning from 'Low Rise Apartment and Town Housing (ZLR32) – Brighouse Village (City Centre)' to 'Low Rise Rental Apartment (ZLR44) – Brighouse Village (City Centre)' to permit the development of a 100% rental residential apartment development consisting of two 6-storey buildings, containing approximately 338 units. The proposal includes approximately 20,510 m2 (220,764 ft2) of purpose-built market rental housing, and approximately 3,374 m2 (36,316 ft2) of purpose-built moderate income rental housing based on BC Housing’s Housing Income Limits (HILs). All purpose-built market rental units and moderate income rental units will be secured in perpetuity with rental tenure zoning and housing agreements registered on Title. The building will meet Energy Step Code step 3 and will provide an on-site low carbon energy plant designed to connect to the future off-site City Centre district energy utility (DEU) system.

zoning.previousZoningDescription: Low Rise Apartment and Town Housing - Brighouse Village (City Centre)
zoning.newZoningDescription: Low Rise Rental Apartment - Brighouse Village (City Centre)

description: Rezoning of 7600 & 7620 Ash Street from the “Single Detached (RS1/F)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/E)” zone and the “Single Detached (ZS14) – South McLennan (City Centre)” zone, in order to subdivide into five single family lots with two fronting Ash Street and three fronting the proposed extension of Armstrong Street. Two existing homes on the subject properties are proposed to be retained.

zoning.previousZoningDescription: Single Detached residential zone with a floor area ratio of 0.6
zoning.newZoningCode: Single Detached (RS2/E) and Single Detached (ZS14) – South McLennan (City Centre)
zoning.newZoningDescription: Single Detached residential zone with a floor area ratio of 0.7 and Single Detached residential zone for the City Centre area

description: Rezoning of 7480 Williams Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Coach House (ZS12) - Broadmoor” zone, to permit the property to be subdivided to create two lots. Each lot would have a principal dwelling and an additional smaller dwelling unit above an attached garage, with vehicle access from Williams Road via a shared driveway.

address: Richmond Zoning Bylaw No. 8500, Amendment Bylaw No. 9973

behalf: property owners (Muhammad A. Khan, Najia R. Khan)
description: Rezoning of 11760 Williams Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Compact Single Detached (RC2)” zone, to permit a subdivision to create two single-family lots. Each lot is proposed to have a single detached dwelling with a secondary suite and vehicle access from the rear lane.

applicant: Simarbir S. Khangura and Lakhbir S. Khangura
description: Rezoning of 6340 Granville Avenue from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Compact Single Detached (RC2)” zone to permit subdivision into two compact lots with vehicle access from an extended rear lane on the south property line. The applicant is required to dedicate the lane to the City prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw and enter into a Servicing Agreement with the City for design and construction of the lane prior to subdivision approval.

address: 6831 Graybar Road, 20455 Dyke Road, 20911 Dyke Road, 7500 No. 9 Road, Lot A Block 4N Plan EPP113853 Section 9 Range 4W New Westminster Land District & SEC 16, 17, 20 (031-553-231)
description: Rezoning to create the “Industrial Business Park and Marina (ZI20) – Graybar Road (East Richmond)” zone, discharge Land Use Contract 127, and permit a light industrial development and boat yard. Proposed multi-phase development consisting of two two-storey buildings (Phase 1 and 2), and three additional buildings in undetermined future phases (Phases 3-5). Existing 1,551 m2 (16,700 ft2) building and additional structures proposed to be retained in the interim.

zoning.previousZoningCode: Industrial and Marina (ZI17), Industrial Business Park (IB1), Light Industrial (IL)
zoning.previousZoningDescription: Industrial and Marina, Industrial Business Park, Light Industrial

description: Rezoning of 11460 Williams Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Compact Single Detached (RC2)” zone, to permit a subdivision to create two lots with vehicle access from the rear lane. Each lot will be approximately 9.1 m wide and 307 m² in area. The applicant has proposed to construct a two-bedroom secondary suite of approximately 42.7 m² (460 ft²) in each of the new dwellings.

The applicant wants to rezone 9231 Kilby Street from the 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' zone to the 'Single Detached (RS2/A)' zone in order to permit the property to be subdivided into two single-family residential lots each with vehicle access from the rear lane. The redevelopment proposes to rezone and subdivide one existing single-family property into two new single-family lots and vehicular access from the rear lane. Both of the new lots will provide a minimum one-bedroom secondary suite.

Rezoning of 9271 Kilby Street from the 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' zone to the 'Single Detached (RS2/A)' zone in order to permit the property to be subdivided into two single-family residential lots each with vehicle access from the rear lane.

The applicant wants to rezone the property at 4700 No. 3 Road from the “Auto-Oriented Commercial (CA)” Zone to a New “High Rise Office Commercial (ZC44) – Aberdeen Village” Zone. The revised proposal includes retaining two floors as leasable office space, restricting the 5th floor to a maximum of two strata lots and the remaining three floors to a maximum of 12 strata lots per floor. The applicant also offers a voluntary cash contribution of $357,044.61 to the City’s Affordable Housing Reserve.

zoning.newZoningDescription: High Rise Office Commercial - Aberdeen Village

description: Rezoning of 4880 Garry Street from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/A)” zone, to permit the property to be subdivided to create two lots. Each lot approximately 9.7 m in width and 386 m2 in area. Construction of a one-bedroom secondary suite in the dwelling on one of the future lots and a cash contribution to the City’s Affordable Housing Reserve Fund in-lieu of constructing a secondary suite on the other future lot.

Rezoning of 6571 and 6591 No. 1 Road from the 'Single Detached (RS1/F)' zone to the 'Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)' zone in order to develop an eight-unit townhouse project, with access from No. 1 Road.

Rezoning of 8720/8740 Rosemary Avenue from the 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' zone to the 'Single Detached (RS2/B)' zone to permit the property to be subdivided to create two single detached lots, both with vehicle access from Rosemary Avenue. Existing legal non-conforming duplex on the property would be demolished. Each of the duplex units and secondary suites are currently rented. Surrounding development includes single detached dwellings, a farm, and other single detached dwellings created through rezoning and subdivision. Proposed rezoning and subdivision are consistent with the Official Community Plan and Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500/Single-Family Lot Size Policy.

Rezoning of 9631 Patterson Road from the 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' zone to a new site specific 'Single Detached (ZS30) - Patterson Road' zone in order to permit the property to be subdivided into two single-family residential lots each with access from Patterson Road. The proposed zone includes setback requirements specified by the Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure applicable to the rear and side yards adjacent to Highway 99 but is otherwise modeled on the City's existing 'Single Detached (RS2/B)' zone.

Rezoning of 6500 Cooney Road from the “Low Density Townhouses (RTL1)” zone to the “Parking Structure Town Housing (ZT93) - Brighouse (City Centre)” zone in order to permit the development of six townhouse units over a common parking structure with vehicle access from a new lane. A four-storey building fronting Cook Road consisting of six townhouse units, including one convertible unit, over a partially enclosed parking structure. Maximum floor area ratio (FAR) of 1.2, additional floor area ratio (FAR) of 0.01 for shared indoor amenity space, and a maximum height of 15 m. Total floor area of approximately 747 m2 (8,042 ft2). Road dedication and construction of new lane along the east property line. Statutory rights-of-way (SRW) along Cook Road to allow sidewalk and lane to meander on-site for tree retention purposes.

zoning.newZoningDescription: Parking Structure Town Housing - Brighouse (City Centre)

description: Rezoning of 9200, 9220, 9240, 9260, 9280, 9300, 9320, and 9340 Francis Road from 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' to 'Town Housing (ZT94)-Francis Road (Broadmoor)' to permit the development of 25 townhouse units with vehicle access from Francis Road.

Rezoning of the site at 10340, 10360, 10380, 10400 and 10420 No. 4 Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” Zone to the “Medium Density Townhouses (RTM2)” Zone in order to develop a 19-unit townhouse project, including four studio secondary suites, with access from No. 4 Road.
